website_summaries.verdict: For those who seek an affordable rollator from an industry leader, this is one to consider. Some durability issues with plastic components, but overall a good "travel" model.
pros: Narrow profile is easier to fit through doorways
cons: Overall dimensions may be smaller than advertised
Maximum height setting not good for taller users

customer_reviews.title: Drive Rollator wheels keep breaking
customer_reviews.text: This is my Mom's second Drive Rollator which the wheel bearing break! The 1st Rollator wheel broke the same way. I thought it was just fluke so I brought another one. The second Rollator did not last 2 months! There must be some issue with the bearings because they break down. Four wheels costs almost as much as a new walker. I plan to find another wheel manufacturer or buy another brand of Rollator.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed that we didn't get the information before the purchase
customer_reviews.text: Here is my issue with this. In the description of the product it doesn't specify that it is much heavier. I purchased this for my 86 year old mom, and as independent as she is, she could not lift this in and out of her car. Her arthritis makes it too heavy. So I paid $55 to buy it. It will cost $50 to return it. I'm going to donate it instead and will find one elsewhere. Very disappointed that we didn't get the information before the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad customer service/replacement
customer_reviews.text: After 9 months, the black seat cracked on my Mother's Rollater. She weighs 125lbs so that wasn't the issue. When contacted the Drive Co directly, I was told the seat is only warranted for 60 days and replacement one was $50. The whole rollator was $54. Not Happy and won't purchase from Drive again.
customer_reviews.author: Carmen

customer_reviews.title: How can you sell faulty products in good conscience?
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 3 days. It is sturdy and easy to handle. My mom's mobility improved dramatically for the 2 days. Then the break stopped working so that when you push down the breaks - so you can sit on it when tired or to park - it moves/rolls away. My mom almost fell. I am so mad.
customer_reviews.author: BooksIRead

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: half of the spokes on one of the tires were broken
customer_reviews.author: Judy A. Barfield

customer_reviews.title: I am very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this product; however, I have only had it about two months and today the seat snapped in half. I would like to obtain a replacement seat. If the seat were made of a sturdier material, I would give this product five stars.
customer_reviews.author: DWillis

customer_reviews.title: Not for Short People, People with Arthritis, People with Fluid in Their Legs, or Average Size or Larger Backsides. DISAPPOINTED.
customer_reviews.text: My mom is 4' 11. Her feet dangle and there is no way to adjust it so she's closer to the ground. Had to find her a block to rest her feet on so she can safely get on it and the fluid won't build up in her leg while she's using it. The brakes are very hard to set with arthritic hands. Also, my 115 pound mom hangs over the very small seat. Trying to find information on possibly ordering a replacement seat. Wish she'd just let me send it back, but she doesn't want to "trouble" me any more than she already has.
customer_reviews.author: Shantel

customer_reviews.title: Product came damaged
customer_reviews.text: I got 2 loaners from the thrift store and each had a problem so I thought I'd just buy a new one. But when the new one came the braces to hold the seat in place were both broken with no damage to the outside of the box. I would have returned it, but the box got cut up before I attempted to put on the seat. Now the front wheel does not work and I'm trying to fix that too. Apparently there isn't any quality control before packaging!
customer_reviews.author: Miss

customer_reviews.title: Safe and Sturdy Mobility Aid
customer_reviews.text: I did some extensive online research before buying this product.My objectives were to find a Rollator which was substantially constructed, and also one which had oversized wheels. Although this unit, a Drive Medical Steel Rollator is a bit heavier than its aluminum counterparts--the benefits of increased strength and more importantly--stability--in my opinion, more than make up for the weight factor. With this model there are never any issues related to tipping. It is solid, safe, and the end-user is more than pleased with it. The Rollator has improved the quality of her life--and mobility. It is also a great value for the money spent. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: eva & tom

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, lightweight, convenient. Very glad to have this for my Nana.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for my Nana, who is experiencing congestive heart failure. She loves the color (ordered a red), is lightweight enough for her to maneuver easily, and it has plenty of easily accessible storage. My tiny Grandpa can fold and lift it easily into the trunk of a car. It moves well and provides a lot of great support. The seat is super convenient for waiting in lines at the doctor's office or if she needs a rest in the hallway of her assisted living facility, and the breaks are reliable. It's hard to watch your loved ones suffer as they age, but this makes a helpful difference in her life.
customer_reviews.author: JRussell

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, pretty easy to transport, reasonably priced
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father, and it has worked well for him. The walker seems pretty reasonably priced and well built - sturdy, etc. While not exceptionally easy to transport, it does fold up easily without the basket, and I can lift it into the back of our car with minimal effort. My biggest concern with the walker when we got it was the short length of the adjustable handle extensions. Because they are very short, you are unable to raise the handles very much. Someone looking for a walker for a person over 5'10" might not find this suitable.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Kelley

customer_reviews.title: Ineligible for return!!!
customer_reviews.text: Arrived on time, easy to assemble but mom cant lift it into her car. It doesn't fold up easily or stay closed when lifting it. She's in an independent living center so we can't help her. When I tried to return it, it says it isn't eligible for returns! Really disappointed since we have to buy another. If an item isn't eligible for return it should be clearly posted!!
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: It's A Wonderful Life
customer_reviews.text: Balance, balance, falls, and "this is not happening"! My life changed when I could no longer deny what was happening. I had other "walkers" that looked okay but were not stable enough to keep me upright. I bought Drive Medical Four Wheel Rollator and it has given me my life back! It's lightweight and very sturdy. It has all the bells and whistles for about half the price of others. I ordered it and received it within 2 days. (Amazing Amazon!) It required no assembly so I took it out of the box and went for a walk! The walker is great and so is Amazon! Thank you so much for a product that is affordable and sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customerlois A.

customer_reviews.title: A simple guide to put this walker together
customer_reviews.text: The walker comes without any set up instructions. We sort of figured it out about where to put all of these little parts that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy

customer_reviews.title: design needs improvement,,
customer_reviews.text: excellent buy practly give away . wery sturdy folds easily , my only complaint is as will all rollators . they fold very easily but there is no way to lock them in folded position so leaning them against the wall is tricky must engage the breaks and make sure it is resting on the wheels the brakes are on or it will open itself,, another problem , because you can not lockk th closed when folded it is very difficult for a woman in my case to keep it together with my handds lift it inti the van and set it down in a position where it will not unfold itself,, also. it is not rturnable so beware ,
customer_reviews.author: C. stout

customer_reviews.title: Nice Walker with minor drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Walker four my mother. The reasons for only 4 stars. The strap to fold the Walker is in the seat which enables easy folding, but this Walker is a bit heavier than traditional styles so there it's a bit of a trade off. The little bag it comes with its not the best quality and one of the straps to secure it broke when i simply put it on. Furthermore the bag will not stay on the Walker with out something significant inside, but because of its construction nothing too heavy should be put inside. The cup/bottle holder is too small/ shallow for practical use.
customer_reviews.author: James Clyde

customer_reviews.title: If you need a walker, this is the one to get
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product at an excellent price. So much easier to use than the hospital issued push walker. Sturdy construction. Just bought a second one to keep in the car. Found a large basket that rests on the seat, tightened it with zip ties and added a layer of rubber shelf protector. Now it's easy to carry drinks and food while using the walker in the house. Love how easy the height can be adjusted...especially if you're tall...so you don't have to walk bent over. For an outing, the seat makes a good resting place. By the way, the blue one is currently cheaper than the red.
customer_reviews.author: CharmY2K

customer_reviews.title: Basket does not fit
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice walker rollator but inadequate assembly instructions come with it. There is no one to call as the distributor is in Great Britain. The basket does not fit which is the most important feature I wanted. You need to be handy with tools to install it. Guess I will just attach it with wire so it will not fall out. The adjustable handles can pose a hazard if not tightly secured but no instructions were included about this. It is not returnable. Don't bother ordering the additional hook or cup holder as neither fit this walker.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: NOT RELIABLE, AND BROKEN
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but defective. NOT RELIABLE, very unstable, one of the wheel was broken and bent.... the other one, was about to bent....luckily my 82 years old grandma did not tested it..she could had an accident....
customer_reviews.author: Mony Fuentes

customer_reviews.title: Poor Choice!!
customer_reviews.text: I obviously bought a return. Can understand why because the previous owner, like me, must have been very PO'd about the difficulty (impossibility) of getting the left hand brake into the steel tube which was way out-of-round. Fortunately I have to tools to rectify this situation. The manufacturer seems to not have any inkling about quality control and the inspection processes. Packaging was a disaster or I too would have returned this product that mistakenly calls itself a four wheel rollator that "... was built to exacting standards and carefully inspected prior to shipment." Big Joke!!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Seat cracked, item is not sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: This is not a 300 lb weight limit. I am well under the weigh limit and the lift up wooden seat plank that is covered with a leather-like padded material has cracked. This chair portion is not usable anymore and I am out of the return window. I had surgery on both my feet and need it to rest periodically. Consider a sturdier product for a higher dollar value of this is something you need long term.
customer_reviews.author: Liza Brizaa

customer_reviews.title: UNELIGIBLE FOR RETURN
customer_reviews.text: Buyers beware. This wheel walker is uneligible for returns for any reason.
customer_reviews.author: choiwj

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product at a Great Price
customer_reviews.text: I have lower back problems, so it helps to use a shopping cart when I go shopping. There are times, such as at the mall, where there are no shopping carts available and this item is perfect for those times. It would be great to use on a cruise, too. Wheelchairs are too large on those ships. This Drive Medical Rolator is sturdy and well-made; and mine is red! My favorite color! The handlebars can be lowered or raised for a person's height and swiveled in or out a little for more or less width, if you get my drift. The instructions say it has a lifetime warranty.
customer_reviews.author: JanetEC

customer_reviews.title: Broke on first use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker because I need one to help me get around after falling and breaking my hip on a skateboard. But when I tried to use it the wheel literally snapped off and I almost fell because of it! I included a picture of the broken wheel. I don’t suggest buying this walker because it may end up causing more harm than good.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Works great, especially for unpaved areas or uneven pavement.
customer_reviews.text: After using the walker for sever months, my findings are these: 1)very effective on uneven or grassy areas. 2)basket is useful, but somewhat confusing and seat will not fold up with basket in place. 3) Brakes are good for keeping steady but do not expect them to stop you, as both brake and wheels will slide. 4)Much cheaper from Amazon than in retail for similar quality. 5) While being fairly intuitive, virtually no instructions were provided for assembly or maintenance. 6) much better for outdoors than indoors, but works well for both
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Increases mobility for elderly--Dad loves it!
customer_reviews.text: My 88 year old dad loves this. Previously, he was using a cane and had a few falls due to balance issues, peripheral neuropathy in feet, and arthritis in the knee. His physical therapist recommended this by name. We got it for Dad and he loves it. He uses it all the time inside the house and out. Uses it for grocery shopping and walking around the local track for exercise. Gives him the added stability he needs, yet it is lightweight and very easy to maneuver. My elderly mom can fold it and stow it in the car when they go out; she takes it out and off they go. In short, it has kept him active and moving.
customer_reviews.author: Always Reading

customer_reviews.title: DREADFUL
customer_reviews.text: It was shipped in most flimsy carton imaginable. It was torn open on two sides. One of wheels was outside the carton. The wheel is bent and the cap is cracked. The booklet and directions are for another model entirely. It is impossible to assemble. The cap for the handle height adjustment has threads so far inside there is no way of screwing it on. I will not have this replaced for that reason. There is obviously an QC problem.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara G.

customer_reviews.title: Design is odd but it's sturdy
customer_reviews.text: There’s a bit of a design flaw. The handles angle out by 2 inches and the handles are the widest part. The width of the seat should have matched those extra 2 inches. Seat holds 300 pounds but too tight for a 220 pound. Height of handles fully extended is best for 5’10” or shorter. On a good note it appears to be very sturdy. It has minimal assembly which reduces points of failure. So one device I bought my mother has 6 assembly points and any of those points can become loose, this has only 2 assembly points.
customer_reviews.author: Maria R

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny!  Has Truly Help Me Getting Around.
customer_reviews.text: I am recovering from some rather serious health issues and my leg muscles are weak and make it difficult to maintain my balance, as well as I lack endurance. This has given me the stability I need, as well as the ability to sit when I need a rest. Very sturdy and easy to use. I was able to shop around at two different stores the other day (something I have been unable to do for quite some time) using this rollator. For the price, you cannot beat it! I have seen rollators at much higher prices, but why pay more? I would highly recommend this rollator to anyone!
customer_reviews.author: theartigasfamily

customer_reviews.title: CHEAPER WALKER LAST LONGER THEN EXPENSIVE WALKER
customer_reviews.text: WHEN I BUY THE MORE EXPENSIVE WALKERS THERE WHEELS HAVE A THIN PART IN THE WHEEL WHICH BREAKS REAL FAST PART COST 30.00 NOW THE CHEAPER WALKER LAST LONGER ISNT THAT AMAZING I HAVE HAD THIS WALKER FOR A SHORT TIME I have found another problem the seat is made of cardboard YES CARD BOARD IT BENDS AT RHE BACK OF YOUR KNEES WHAT A JOKE CARDBOARD WHAT A BUNCH OF CHEAP COMPANY THE BAR UNDER DOES NOT SUPPORT THE SEAT SO IT BENDS THATS REAL FUNNY NOT MENT TO LAST A MONTH
customer_reviews.author: woody

customer_reviews.title: Great Product; Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and good quality. Setup was quick and painless. The handle heights are adjustable. I bought this for a family member with a knee issue, and they're very happy. It's relatively lightweight and rolls smoothly. I inspected all welds and they're better than I expected. The handbrakes work well. When you want to use the seat, you can lock the rear wheels by pushing down on the handbrakes (you'll hear/feel a 'click'). The basket is handy to carry your 'gotta-haves' from one room to another. The wheels are tall enough for outdoor use. A local medical store wanted hundreds of $ for a similar product. This is a great deal! Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: lawdog

customer_reviews.title: Great Chair for Seniors
customer_reviews.text: Bought this chair for my dad and it works well. Very portable. Excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: B. D. Harris Lee

customer_reviews.title: Only lasts about 3 MONTHS, then WHEELS fall off - NOT repairable.  You GET what you PAY for .. ??
customer_reviews.text: Only lasts about 3 MONTHS, then the right-rear wheel fell off while I was using it. It spun me out-of-control, fell due to the sudden lack of mobility and sudden uneven stop. (I'll live). Wheel fell off because the 'plastic' wheel-to-axle bushing wore out (if there WAS any bushing at all. Anyway, not repairable. PROs - It is inexpensive. CONS - Wheels are worthless, both durability AND they are small diameter, can't even traverse a garden hose. (must lift each wheel over EVERY obstruction). Detachable BASKET should be MUCH larger, would not pose a problem.
customer_reviews.author: What the HEY !

customer_reviews.title: Warning! New design must be RECALLED before more people are injured!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Warning, warning, warning!!! This new design must be recalled!!! The manufacturer has changed the design on the seat and the new design is unstable and detaches, causing falls and injuries!!! I just ordered this as a replacement for the exact same product with same product number. Everything was the same except for the seat attachment. Medical professionals reviewed the new seat after my mother fell on a tile floor because the seat detached. They all concurred that the new design was inferior to old design and was unstable. It took less than 24 hours for the design to fail. I learned about fall from paramedics as they prepared to take mother to emergency room.
customer_reviews.author: Christine  Poggianti

customer_reviews.title: Not a reliable device.
customer_reviews.text: I bought one in April, 2018 for my sister who lives in assisted living. By November one rear wheel bearing had failed completely, and the other is not far behind. So, this unit with a lifetime warranty is junk IMO. Buy it with caution. Updated 12/10/18: According to the company, the lifetime warranty applies only to the frame and weld. Everything else is a part, and that's limited to 60 days. So, replacing the wheels will cost more than a new one, and even replacing just the wheel bearings is about the same cost as a new one.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin R

customer_reviews.title: Truly a bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this walker for my mother and am extremely impressed with the quality. The walker moves and turns very easily, and the fully rotating front wheels make it very maneuverable, even for a person with diminished strength. Her home has mostly hardwood floors, but she has no trouble moving across carpeting. My mother is extremely small so this fits our needs perfectly, but I'm not certain how it would perform for a larger than average individual.
customer_reviews.author: pme

customer_reviews.title: Well made and well designed
customer_reviews.text: It was very easy to open up, snap it in usable position, and go. It appears sturdy. For someone my size (5'-6" and 145 lbs) it is a perfect fit. It gets through the standard doors. I am able to maneuver it around very easily. Parking and brakes are adequate. Folding it up is easy. I picked the right size bungee cord to keep it tightly closed once it is collapsed. Appears sturdy and should last for a long time. The larger wheels are better compared to my wife's rollator made by the same company but with 6" wheels. Overall, I would recommend it and feel confident in doing so.
customer_reviews.author: OnLooker

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as previous model
customer_reviews.text: Mom needed a replacement after owning the previous one over 5 years. She loved it, but it started falling apart. I bought what looked like the same model, but there have been some design changes. 1) the basket is now an open wire basket so it's not so good for keys and a credit card. 2) the basket has to be removed to fold the rollator to put in the car. 3) the mechanism to tighten the handles in place is now a plastic lever that can break with too much pressure. They also are on the inside of the handles, so they hit your hips if you sit on the seat. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: FANTASTIC VALUE
customer_reviews.text: Assembles without tools. Levers to tighten hand grips are packed within the bag for the basket - not attached as per instructions. These levers are difficult to tighten by hand but might break if tightened with a wrench. As a former cyclist, I recommend replacing these with QUICK RELEASE levers used on bicycle seat tubes. Look carefully at the picture with the listing to see how to attach under-seat basket. A $6 Sterlite File Crate fits securely atop the seat allowing me to haul groceries from the car. Is there a way to easily secure the walker in the folded position? Overall FANTASTIC VALUE.
customer_reviews.author: BigLars

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I discovered the hard way than when you need to use a walker, that's no time to be frugal. I bought this to replace a cheaper walker I was using. The tires on this walker are large enough that they don't get stuck in the cracks of the sidewalk. While the basket isn't something I use, the seat is great. I like that I can put something on the seat and walk it over to where I need it. Well built, easy to operate. It's a bit of a struggle to get it into and out of the trunk. I'm willing to tolerate that because I have so much better maneuverability with this walker.
customer_reviews.author: Deb

customer_reviews.title: For those that need help getting around
customer_reviews.text: I have DISH a debilitating disease that calcifies ligaments and tendons. I use to live an active life, but this has shut me down. I like to be outside, but I can only stand or walk for a few minutes before the pain starts in. This rollator allows me to walk for a longer period of time and then being able to sit. More important it can be used over lawns and most fields.
customer_reviews.author: ChiefBard

customer_reviews.title: HORRIBLE!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 71 year old ailing father who suffers from cancer. He needed support to attend a family party because he gets tired easy. My dad sat in the chair part and the wheel cracked!!! He started to fall over and thankfully my mom was able to catch him before he hit the floor. This chair/walker is a lawsuit waiting to happen!!! My father could’ve been seriously injured. The company did not want to refund me but thankfully Amazon is an amazing company and took care of it right away!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Features desired at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my mother who is regaining strength after a stroke. Since I’m an RN, I have been around many strollers. This stroller is ergonomic, has comfortable hand breaks that can be locked for a stable object to help stand. The front wheels rotate nicely for smooth ride. The seat is great for taking a break, or transporting objects from one room to another. The basket is helpful for that as well. The width is large enough to sit fairly comfortably but small enough to mange through door frames and hallways.
customer_reviews.author: DymplzRN

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to keep in the car so I wouldn’t have to haul the walker I use in the house and put it in the car when going somewhere. Pros: very sturdy, easy to assemble, durable, easily fits in my car trunk (I drive a Focus). Cons: it’s heavier than the Drive walker I use in the house so it’s difficult for me to lift it in and out of the car and the width is smaller than my other walker - that’s not a problem for me but might be for a large person.
customer_reviews.author: avidreaderinwi

customer_reviews.title: Out of 5 stars, I rate it a 6!
customer_reviews.text: Superb item! Stable, maneuverable, light weight and flexibility of use. Durable construction. The only thing I'd add if I were building this item, is an additional 2 inches of hand grip height for us tall people. Seat height is perfect for sliding under a standard sized table so you can sit on it while having dinner or for any job that needs to be done while sitting. CAUTION: While the brake system works fine, this item is not designed to be used as a wheel chair. Roll it to the desired location, set the hand brake, and THEN sit down.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Weller

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy unless 100% sure you can use it.
customer_reviews.text: We bought this walker for my father and when his physical therapist saw he said it was not the right size for him. Unfortunately we cannot return it, since Amazon won't accept returns for it. How could we know if it was the right size, without first trying it. Plus, it arrived with the box all torn up, no booklet or instructions. BTW, my father is 5"9' and its too short for him to use properly.
customer_reviews.author: XC in LB

customer_reviews.title: great product and excellent customer service
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother and it is a great product, much better than her former walker which had smaller, non-swivel wheels. The built-in seat is a great feature. The basket is partially blocked by the seat, but is still usable. One of the brake handles was difficult to press into the locked position, so I contacted customer service and they sent me an entire replacement brake mechanism which arrived the next day. I could not ask for better customer service.
customer_reviews.author: M. Zehngut

customer_reviews.title: Warning! Collapsed on my mother!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my mother earlier this year and it lasted approximately 6 months and ended up collapsing with her sitting on the seat! She ended up with torn muscles and bruises! This product is absolutely horrible!
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Lenos

customer_reviews.title: Helpful
customer_reviews.text: I got this walker to replace my old one. It's a good Walker. I like the wheels alot. They're big so i feel safer on them when I sit. I use my walker as a wheelchair cause I have MS and can't walk. My upstairs is lil small for a wheelchair. Even a small one and this works great. So if u have to. Even thou its not recommended and i don't necessarily do either but it's ok in short distances. Only thing i don't like is arms r lil too close. Seat width is a lil small but other those. Its a great buy
customer_reviews.author: Vina

customer_reviews.title: Flimsy product with weak wheel bearings.
customer_reviews.text: After about a month of use, a bearing on left rear wheel failed and wheel fell off. Ball bearing was crushed. Fortunately, my sister in law was not injured. Upon examination, the failed bearing was in three pieces and the little steel balls were gone. Very flimsy ball bearing. Cheaply made product.
customer_reviews.author: wdm

customer_reviews.title: Great light weight walker. Easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: No longer needed this walker after it arrived so ended up returning it : ( Wish we had use for it. Very nice. Arrived promptly. Only thing you need to do to assemble, is insert handlebars and back/front frame. The rest comes assembled and folded. Never assembled it or used it, but were able to stand it up and the wheels moved easily. it unfolded easily as well. Great little walker for the price and cool red color. Packaging could have been better. The walker is not wrapped in any protective packaging and the box arrived with open holes where wear and tear occurred during shipment. Very surprised the walker wasn't damaged (that we could tell) from the shipment itself.
customer_reviews.author: SR

customer_reviews.title: dissappointed - doesn't stay folded, basket is metal and pops off
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed. This doesn't fold with the basket attached. The basket is hard to attached and easily pops off. I purchased this other model 2 years ago and it was MUCH MUCH BETTER: "The Drive Medical Aluminum Rollator Walker Fold Up and Removable Back Support, Padded Seat, 6" Wheels"
customer_reviews.author: Colleen T

customer_reviews.title: Great - but make sure there's someone to help with assembly
customer_reviews.text: I shipped this to my in-laws and they couldn't figure out how to assemble it. Make sure you have someone receiving it that is capable of assembling. This sat in the garage, unassembled, for months before I found out. Now I'm sending a handyman over to their house to put it together. Meantime, some parts either got lost or were missing from the original package. Make sure the handyman checks that all the parts are there. Good price though, as some local medical supply places are charging $250 for the same thing (so I was told).
customer_reviews.author: Robin

customer_reviews.title: things to know
customer_reviews.text: it's ok. cap was missing to cover top of nut of one wheel. but amazon made it right. with a credit. so far so good. not the best. not the worst. more of an in between. but it does the job. at the right price. for me I am satisfied with it. and amazon. for taking care of a small problem. storage box not so great. but i bought it to get around. not really to carry stuff with. all in all it works for me. just my personal opinion. thanks amazon. great doing business with you
customer_reviews.author: Bill W.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent walker
customer_reviews.text: Really good. It has large wheels for easy rolling (twice the size of many I've seen), a seat to use when you have to stop and wait somewhere, which doubles as a place to put things to carry them. Has a nice basket for carrying things also. Got this for my wife, who has Parkinson's and needs a stable support when walking any distance. It's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn Jackman

customer_reviews.title: need for daily use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this just before my vacation to assist me with walking distances. The first time it was checked into the airport at the gate, I received it back with a broken handle and tweaked so the wheels were not even on the ground. I did not expect this to happen so I question the durability of this product. Of course the airline has to answer for this also. I did not make another purchase because the Veteran's Administration replaced it with a different model.
customer_reviews.author: D. Rusovick

customer_reviews.title: Easy to assemble--so far so good!!!
customer_reviews.text: The rollator walker came pre-assembled, I only had to put on the basket, the handles and the front bar, they all snapped into place. I must admit, the handles gave me a little issue, At first, I wasn't able to secure the handlebars in place. I had to turn the knob several times and at first, it didn't appear to work, the handles kept sliding all the way down. But after 5 minutes of turning, the knob started to tighten; thus, the handlebars stayed at the desired height needed. The large wheels rolled smoothly, and the breaks work great!!!! (I gave it 4 stars because of the issue with the handlebar).
customer_reviews.author: Doasm Memoir: VBJ

customer_reviews.title: Good for short term
customer_reviews.text: Broke my ankle. Needed something to get around the house that I can sit on and scoot with. Kind of flimsy. The seat has bent and the bar that collapses the chair, is also bending. If its an every day use, maybe go with a more sturdy walker but I am pretty satisfied. I couldn't have gotten along without it. Its small enough where it can be tucked in a corner without closing it up. I sit opposite the handle bars and its hard to move forward that way. Its meant to move the other way but have gotten used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: She loves it
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this walker for my 88 yr. old mother after a fall, hospital, then rehab and 23 days in assisted living hell. She was not sure about this walker at first. Now she uses it to walk in her yard and pick up sticks and "survey" the landscaping. Without this walker, her only trips outside would be to check the mail (with help) or sit on the porch. The walker is easy for her to maneuver and lightweight. Her neighbor got one after seeing hers. Great walker.
customer_reviews.author: yomoma

customer_reviews.title: Roll on Grandma!
customer_reviews.text: This product was ordered as a warehouse deal and arrived in great condition. Price was great too! All that was fine and expected. The really great thing about this product is that it gave an 89 year old 85 lb. woman the freedom to get out of bed and get moving. We have tried three different rolling walkers and this one is light and maneuverable and clearly the favorite.
customer_reviews.author: Mort

customer_reviews.title: but it' a sturdy thing and has good battery range
customer_reviews.text: Man, this is the buggy for us 'gimp peeps'. I used to have a breathing problem, just taking a short stroll, now nothing. I have.found places and met people that I never would before swallowing my pride and crusing with this buggy.. Now don't get me wrong, it might go 5 mph over a cliff (keeps the paint from sliding backward) and it does give you an account of the of every line in the sidewalk(solid rubber wheels), but it' a sturdy thing and has good battery range. Not only that but it goes over grass , rock's, etc. (I don't think it would work in a blizzard or monsoon)
customer_reviews.author: jws2346

customer_reviews.title: Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: Love this product. Have one for outside and one for in the house. It's very sturdy. Makes it very easy to get around. And the ocassional seat works well for quick breaks. I use the walker seat for carrying all sorts of things like dishes from the washer to the cabinet. And firewood from the garage to the fireplace. Outside I use it for getting around the property and gardening. The wheels are a little small for going over grass but I've made it work. I'd be a lot less mobile without it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael D. Sproul

customer_reviews.title: Works well, does not fold well.
customer_reviews.text: The walker works very well. It is very stable, and is well built. The wheels are big, so it goes over carpet, cracks in sidewalks easily. But it does not really fold up. You can fold it and it only changes the footprint very little. Also there is no locking mechanism to keep it folded, it just flops back open. So putting it in a car trunk is not easy. So if you don't really need it to fold up, this walker is great. It has a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Wings

customer_reviews.title: She loves “little Red” wheels.
customer_reviews.text: Great support for anyone going through recovering their balance. This moves easily around the house and I am amazed at the precision of how it can turn and get into small areas. I am so glad we selected one with a seat because it is always there if she needs to rest and it is used so often to carry bags, phone or even a plate of food. I would highly recommend this model. We have had it for about 4 months and we will fold it up and keep it around even after she no longer needs it—just in case.
customer_reviews.author: Lendea

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to maneuver, is nice looking, comfortable to sit on, nice feature of the bucket beneath seat to carry items. One drawback is that my husband, who is 6 ft. 2in, finds it "short". We have raised the handle as far as it will go and he still has to lean over a bit to use it. Would be more effective and comfortable if the handle could be raise higher and he could stand upright. Would be fabulous for a shorter person.
customer_reviews.author: Docsdaughter45

customer_reviews.title: Bad/Useless placement of seat/basket
customer_reviews.text: The seat opens up right into the basket so the basket is basically useless because you can't put anything in it if you want to lift the seat up. Never lift the seat and you can place something in the basket. However, difficult to reach under and retrieve. It got two starts because it works out except the bad/ridiculous placement of the basket/seat.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: Love it! Great buy! Awesome price
customer_reviews.text: It gets me through those tough days when I NEED to run errands and my back won’t let me without a fight! Easy to handle! The seat is such a lifesaver when I just can’t take another step and need to sit! It gets me up and out of the house and it’s what I needed after I feel a couple times! I stopped going out for fear of falling and this Gave me the security I needed and still do! And getting out of the house is necessary on several levels!!
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: I need one of these for my mother-in-law, and naturally I was looking for a cheap one that might collapse often. Unfortunately, this one was extremely sturdy and has great brakes. I tried loosening the brakes, but these suckers are on there really good. Okay, all kidding aside, this thing is great. It folds up and is easy to place in the car. The handles have a really nice spot that is flared out to rest the palm and side of the hand to prevent slippage or fatigue. The breaks are easy to use without having to reach awkwardly. The seat is comfortable for her even without adding a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: James P.

customer_reviews.title: This is the superior rollator, compared all the common models.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad. Assembled pretty easily although the seat was defective and the seller promptly sent a replacement. Once assembled is functioned great. The brakes are very ergonomic. He lived (sniff) in an assisted living community and I had to ability to compare all of the popular rollator models. This model is superior to all the others in some way. The little basket is a nice feature, the ease of adjustment of the bars, the stability...it is the one to get.
customer_reviews.author: catdad

customer_reviews.title: Best Gift Ever!
customer_reviews.text: My friend just had her hip replaced. She only had one of those old silver walkers. I purchased the four wheel Rollator walker with a seat and basket on it for her. She is 83 and she calls the walker her Cadillac. She said she can carry so many things in the basket. When she gets tired, she can seat down and rest. It turns on a dime and makes walking so much easier. I am so thankful that I could help and bless her.
customer_reviews.author: lynn T.

customer_reviews.title: Rollators give you both confidence and speed.
customer_reviews.text: I have had a rollator since February. My sister-in-law was visiting, and also has mobility issues. I explained how I had used one of these units to gain the confidence to go almost anywhere, and that it led me to not always rely on an appliance. She showed interest, so I ordered one for her. Phone reports indicate she is walking her dog for the first time in a long time and having the same great experience I had.
customer_reviews.author: Al93lante

customer_reviews.title: Considering a 2nd
customer_reviews.text: Even though I feel it is clumsy, heavy, with too small a basket I am considering a red one for my other car. I buy a lot of photographic gear and pay more to get carbon fiber which is stronger and lighter. I wish Amazon sold one like this in carbon fiber that was easier to fold up and has a larger basket. This one is lunch size.
customer_reviews.author: J-Review

customer_reviews.title: Solid and well built
customer_reviews.text: I bought this when I was recovering from an ankle infection and found that it made my recovery much easier. Smooth operation and nicely placed features really helped in my day to day. I even took it to a convention for my business and found it was great to have a place to sit down on the trade show floor. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: S. Back

customer_reviews.title: Wife loves this walker
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this walker! Frankly though, the assembly instructions are virtually worthless, and that sucks, but it's really not all that hard to figure out. For the positives: The hand brakes/parking brakes work wonderfully well. My wife loves the seat, since she has to rest frequently, and she makes good use of the basket, too. In summary: "A+" for design and function. "F" for lack of useful assembly instructions. Helpful hint: Refer to the product photos, here on Amazon, for proper assembly.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby W

customer_reviews.title: Very convenient and useful
customer_reviews.text: Love it as much as the one I previously had and gave to my 90 year old father. Got this one for my 87 year old mother. Only disappointment is that the plastic cap that goes over the hex bolt was split for the one side and fell off in the box it was shipped in. Didn’t notice that it was missing from the walker until I found it loose in the box when breaking down to recycle. Tried to glue the split but didn’t work. Hoping I can have a replacement Bolt cap sent.
customer_reviews.author: flo

customer_reviews.title: Unbelievably Low Price For an Excellent (Small) Rollator/Walker
customer_reviews.text: I am a big guy, 300+ lbs. I have a wonderful Comodità Spazio Extra Wide Heavy-Duty Rollator that I use outside the house. However, it is too large to comfortably move around in the house. It can be pretty tight getting through smaller doors and in tight spaces. I did not need one inside the house that I could sit on, but I enjoy having the seat to put a plate of food or other items on. The basket is a bonus. It rolls well and has good brakes. I can't believe it sells for only $55. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Preyer

customer_reviews.title: long lasting
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my mother. She uses it daily for the last year and a half and so far has had not issues with any breakage or wearing out at all. The locks on the handles are great. She can sit and rest when she wants to. The color red is pretty. The only downside is that it does not fold flat, just maybe half way, so pretty much takes up the whole back of the car when taking her somewhere, but it is worth it. Not too heavy to lift out of the back of the car and easy to unfold. It is super maneuverable and smooth rolling.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I needed a walker when I came home from the hospital and I had purchased a similar kind for my mom several years ago. She loved it and so I bought this one for me. The walker provided by Medicare does not have much of anything and I wanted the basket so that I could put items in it to move from place to place, plus the brakes worked perfectly when I needed to stand up or sit down! I'd buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Barb T

customer_reviews.title: 4 wheel rollator make it easier and convenient.
customer_reviews.text: My husband got stroke. I purchased the 4 wheel rollator for my husband. He loves it and it is easy for him to use it and move around. We took it to South Dakota for our vacation. Thankful for seat, he can sit down then walk around. Red is his favorite color. Its perfect. Nice to have basket under the seat so he can put his ipad or anything put in there, not have to carry, free hand to move the rollator. Thank you!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melinda Fennert

customer_reviews.title: a real blessing
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this walker for my wife's mother and it was a great choice. She didn't think she needed a walker but now she uses it a lot! It is easy to fold and place in the car and it is very maneuverable. She uses it a lot around the kitchen because she can use the seat to rest when needed. The braking system is another nice feature and holds the walker in place. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Fred D.

customer_reviews.title: fantastic
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with the quality of this product. It was super simple to add the basket and handlebars. It is sturdy and it will provide me safety and independence. I have a bulging disc and the nerve in my leg is very much affected. This will provide me support and the ability to sit down quickly when needed. It also lets me walk just a bit bent which takes stress off the nerves in my spine. I am very pleased. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: Linda Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Rolls nicely.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this 5 stars even though I had difficulties with it. Couldn't insert the handles because the tube has a hard plastic piece in it, which can't just be pulled out. One was broken as if someone had already tried to remove it, and I bought this as a new product. I pried the plastic guards off and completed assembly. Since then, it has done just fine. I use the seat to carry things from one room to another.
customer_reviews.author: CR

customer_reviews.title: Beware- seat broke after 1 month- user weight of less than 120lbs
customer_reviews.text: At first we loved this walker with the nice seat! It was a fantastic option for her to be able to sit down & rest. Unfortunately- the seat bent in half. Looking closer - we noticed it was made of a heavy cardboard. User only weighs about 120lbs and had used it only a month !!! Everything else is still functional. I cant find anywhere if there is a weight limit- but I would expect more than 120 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: C S

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! CANNOT BE RETURNED!!
customer_reviews.text: Why would a company make a walker that does NOT lock in the folding position?? This is the biggest flaw of this walker. Every time you fold it up it opens back up. So frustrating when trying to load in a car or store it somewhere. How is an elderly person or a disabled person supposed to handle this? We bought this for my husband who is recovering from leg surgery. Luckily for us, I’m not elderly or disabled yet, so I wrestled with this walker every time we went some where. Maddening!! To say the least. Once, it’s in place and you’re using it, the walker is great. Company needs to fix this fatal flaw before someone gets hurt.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara H.

customer_reviews.title: Very Tedious
customer_reviews.text: I've read the previous comments about how good this book is - well, I found it to be very dry with most of the emphasis on his performances with the Ziegfeld Follies - Flo Ziegfeld hated comedians except for Eddie Cantor - he disliked Fields intensely no matter how successful his act was in the Follies (and it was VERY successful) - not much new about his personal life, most of us already know about it, he was an elusive character for meaningful interviews to say the least - it's not a bad book just very tedious in the author's insistence to map out all the scenes in his movies.
customer_reviews.author: Double O Soul

customer_reviews.title: Very useful device
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to give me more mobility and ability to carry items with me when in the house or going other places. It has been a Godsend helping me move around with ease. It folds up well. However, it is a little heavier than I would like and the next time I need one, I will try to find one a little more lightweight. I find it much easier to practice walking with a normal gate when pushing this than while using a cane. I can stand up much straighter and with better posture.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Sue

customer_reviews.title: CANNOT BE RETURNED
customer_reviews.text: Had this delivered to a new home where my mother was going to stay for an extended period of time as we could not travel with her existing walker. We ended up not being able to make the trip so I tried to return the unopened walker. Amazon stated it could not be returned and then I read a comment that Drive has a no return policy. My fault for not doing my research.
customer_reviews.author: M W

customer_reviews.title: She hated the thought of using a walker
customer_reviews.text: My 91 year old mom broke her hip. We bought her this walker after she left Rehab and she loves it so much more than the one she used there. She hated the thought of using a walker, but this one has changed her mind. She won't be without it! It is a bit heavy to load and unload in my car, but well worth it for the added safety benefits. We have named her Esmeralda! :)
customer_reviews.author: cinnamon girl

customer_reviews.title: worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This was not an expensive walker, which made me a little nervous as I got it for my grandma to replace her very simple/outdated walker. She absolutely raves about it and the brakes and that she can sit and set thing on it. She is minimally mobile and disabled- so I know she is putting a lot of weight on it. She seems to be completely pleased, and if something happened and I needed to buy another, I would purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: ConSolo

customer_reviews.title: Sit walker
customer_reviews.text: My mom and I got her this walker for occasional use. She did find it helpful and stabilising, and she enjoyed being able to sit down when needed. I hope she will take it with her for walks. We do wish that the adjustable handles had holes in them, and bolts, so we could adjust them for her height, and let her put her weight without them sliding down. An inch or so higher would be nice. It was a really good deal, though.
customer_reviews.author: Karen F

customer_reviews.title: Lasted 2 months before breaking.
customer_reviews.text: Product broke after two months of normal use. My 82 year-old mother who weighs hardly anything used this to go down the hall for meals in her assisted living center. She liked it, but after 2 months, one of the wheel axles bent and the product is useless.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey A. Butts

customer_reviews.title: Great walker!!
customer_reviews.text: What a great price for this walker. It has a pop up seat with a hidden pouch for your items such as your cellphone or small purse. I love the color. I opted for the electric blue. It’s so easy to put together. The walker is already put together except for the handles and back rest. It takes no tools to assemble. Just pop on the handles and back rest and you are good to go!
customer_reviews.author: mary mcnally

customer_reviews.title: 2 in 6 months, waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This is the 2nd rollator we have purchased in 6 months. On the first one (exact same model) the knob that twists to hold the handles at a certain height broke. This was on delivered last week and that hardware wasn't even included. Save your money, purchase elsewhere. Also, this technically "folds" but there is no way to latch it in the folded position. It just flops awkwardly and wrestling it into the car/etc. is a real pain. I doubt anyone who needs the rollator could maneuver it in the folded position without assistance.
customer_reviews.author: sk1649g

customer_reviews.title: I can get out again!
customer_reviews.text: Really a deal for just $54 you get the quality of much much more expensive rollators. Wheels are terrific on bumps uneven sidewalks obstacles and more. Color pretty and I feel so secure walking now, no more falls for me! Ease of use light weight folds easily. Nothing more you could want/need even comes with basket for your must carry items.
customer_reviews.author: Nana

customer_reviews.title: It was worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to fold,And for the price I thought I was going to get something cheap.I'm happy I bought this chair.Its easy to push around,The brakes works very good,The seat is not hard at all.I just wish it was just a bit wider,Love the color,I weight 265 and I fit in it very well.I would tell anyone that trying to save some money .This walker is worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Trammell

customer_reviews.title: It has been wonderful! It is strong and sturdy and easy for ...
customer_reviews.text: A year ago I had foot surgery and ordered a knee scooter to be able to get around. It just did not work for me and I had to return it. This year I had to have foot surgery again and decided to order the DRIVE Four Wheel Walker to get around. It has been wonderful! It is strong and sturdy and easy for me to use to get around. I use it like a knee scooter by just putting my left knee on the seat while I use my right foot to push myself around. Works like a charm! Thanks Amazon; what did we ever do without you???
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Such a lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: My knee went out and I couldn’t walk for a couple of months and this was a lifesaver. I had a plain walker left from when my Mother was alive and started using that right away, but it was difficult to roll smoothly. Instead of purchasing a walker at the medical supply store, we saw this one online and decided to try it. I’m sure I would have had to pay at least the amount I paid for this on Amazon as my deductible. I love this one and have had no problems with it at all.
customer_reviews.author: Jojob

customer_reviews.title: Didn't Think She'd Like it...SHE DID!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my wife (70s) who is having balance problems. I didn't think she would like it or use it...but, this contraption has given her a LOT more confidence and when she feels a dizzy spell coming on she can just sit down in the seat and wait it out. Ii is very solid, well built and a snap to assemble. I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Buxx

customer_reviews.title: Huge price difference over local retailer and QUICK delivery
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Mother who fell and broke her hip. Went to a Medical Supply store to price these and though they had literally dozens to choose from this seemed the most popular. Exact same product as the Med Supply store and was about $100 cheaper than the store. Easy assembly and even though she doesn't need it as much she still takes it along in the house when standing is too hard for her. btw, the quick delivery made it available almost as soon as the Med Supply store could have gotten one to us, just one day difference. No wonder the guy who owns the Med store drives a BMW!
customer_reviews.author: Smitty

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this one. It will be damaged!
customer_reviews.text: This chair would be good if you can get one that is not damaged. The first one we got had a bent frame where the right front wheel did not touch the ground. We ordered a replacement and this one was worse than the first. One if the wheels, the wheels are made of plastic, the whole inside of the wheel where the spokes would be were broken out so the wheel was useless. The product is made in China, and both boxes looked like they had been through a war so no wonder they were damaged. My advice is to stay away and by an American product!
customer_reviews.author: gail g.

product_meta.title: Drive Medical Four Wheel Walker Rollator with Fold Up Removable Back Support
product_meta.description: Color:BlueSupreme Durability, Safety and Quality In keeping with Drive Medicals tradition of fine craftsmanship and unmatched value, this Four Wheel Rollator Walker with Fold Up Removable Back Support continues to lead the charge when it comes to design, quality and value. A mobility aid in a league all of its own, this walker comes highly recommended by those who seek strength, support, durability and comfort, all mixed with a touch of class. The Four Wheel Rollator Walker comes complete with a padded backrest which is hinged and is removable by folding it either up or down. It also arrives with comfortable seating along with a convenient pouch which you can use to store personal items. The 7.5 inch non-marring wheel casters are ideal for both indoor and outdoor use, as are the easy to use deluxe loop locks. But that’s not all; You also get ergonomic handles that can be adjusted according to your height, making the gripping of handles especially convenient and comfortable, While eliminating undue stress on hands and joints. With the Four Wheel Rollator Walker as your travel companion, there is no need to overstretch yourself, because this rollator doubles as a comfortable and welcomed chair, giving you an opportunity to rest and refresh yourself anywhere and at any time. Go ahead. Experience the drive difference now.
feature_bullets: Four Wheel Rollator provides reliable support with maximum comfort and is ideal for uneven or outdoor terrain
Features deluxe loop locks for safety, non marking wheels, and a convenient pouch for personal belongings
Built in padded seat with backrest and adjustable handle heights ensure customized comfort
Easily store and transport walker by removing or folding backrest into compact size
Handle height: 31 to 37 inch; Seat dimensions 12 inch (L) x 12 inch (W); Weight capacity: 300 pounds
